instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message:
Hi, 

Macbook Pro <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. All rails except <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> are ok. 

Checked <TRANSISTOR>Q7840</TRANSISTOR> and <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> get 5V also get enabled signal but <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> is 0. Changed <TRANSISTOR>Q7840</TRANSISTOR> but still getting 0V on out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message:
Do you get all S0 voltages, including VCORE, only missing <SIGNAL>5V_SUS</SIGNAL>?
Post exact voltages for <TRANSISTOR>Q7822</TRANSISTOR>/40.
Also post exact ohm value to ground at <SIGNAL>5V_SUS</SIGNAL> rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> 0v
threads.message:
Solved. 


Finally it was shorted smc.
